title: M-Pen needs to be addressed in this game
body:
The average squishy through the course of the game with no MR items will have around 20 - 40 MR.

Meanwhile {{item:3020}}  and {{item:3165}} reduces MR by 33 (18+15) and has been the most common build path for mages. If we take a look at item purchases [globally](https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/items) you'd see the first popular AP item is a {{item:3285}} at 11.0%, followed by {{item:3157}} at 10.6% and {{item:3165}} at 8.2% and if we take a look at shoes {{item:3020}} is the second most popular at 19.5%.

Out of all the AP items a Morello and Sorc shoes which reduces more than HALF your MR will be bought 27.7% of games GLOBALLY.

Ludens, Morello and Sorc shoes 11% + 8.6% + 19.5% account for 39.1% of purchases GLOBALLY.
An average level 10 squishy at 20 mins will have 34 MR, you're literally playing the game as if you have 1 MR.

When is this going to be addressed?

My post about this exact thing for downvoted to shit lul
Thing is negatron doesn't build into anything useful.

Looking at global purchases just shows you that every mage builds the exact same thing every game, and that there's no meaningfully different options for most of the class.

Also, I feel like Sorc Shoes almost need to be *excluded* in a discussion on how much magic pen there is, because mages have been balanced around the assumption that they're going to *have* to buy those boots. It's not an optional buff, it's a requirement if you want your champion to hit the break even point the balance team designed around.

Just a null magic mantle is enough to stave off men rushers.

Question
Why are people complaining about men now?
It was stronger prior to the rune rework.

Cause double pen is just bland at this point and Riot doesn't even know what they're doing anymore with AP items.
